page.title: 13HOP GROWING
page.content: A hop is a vine, a tall climbing plant which needs a network of poles and strings to support it when growing. It costs 2500 pounds per acre to set this network up. Some farms in our area grow Yeoman hops which are very bitter. Most hop gardens are surrounded by hedges to protect the plants from wind. Hops are used in the brewing of beer. The hops stop the beer from turning sour. The planting takes place in October and the hops are harvested in September. Today the hops are picked by machine: the whole vine is cut and taken to the picking machine. In the past people came down to Kent to pick the hops in the summer and stayed in "hop pickers huts" After harvesting the hops are taken to the oasthouse where they are dried and packed before being sent to the Hop Marketing Board's warehouse in Paddock Wood for storage until needed.
